revision.text:
{{pp-semi|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = Alfredo Darrington Bowman | image = | caption = | birth_name = Alfredo Darrington Bowman | birth_date = {{birth date|df=yes|1933|11|26}}{{cite news |author= |title=Alfredo Bowman, celebrity herbalist – obituary |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/obituaries/2016/08/23/alfredo-bowman-celebrity-herbalist--obituary/ |date=23 August 2016 |newspaper=The Telegraph |accessdate=19 January 2017}} | birth_place = Ilanga, Honduras| nationality = Honduran | death_date = {{death date and age|df=yes|2016|8|6|1933|11|26}} | death_place = Barrio Ingles [[La Ceiba]], Honduras | death_cause = [[Pneumonia]] | residence = | occupation = Herbalist, Witch doctor {{Cite news |title=Jacko Sees Witch Doctor |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/jacko-sees-witch-doctor-7226338.html}}{{Cite news |title=Jacko's New 'Doctor': No Scrubs, No Diploma |url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2004/03/05/jacko-new-doctor-no-scrubs-no-diploma.html}} | spouse = Patsy Bowman (Mrs. Dr. Sebi){{cite AV media|people=Patsy Bowman|year=2017|title=Holistic Healing|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yHdQ771sivQ|accessdate=18 February 2018|location=Trinidad & Tobago|publisher=Good Morning T&T|via=[[YouTube]]}} | years_active = | alma_mater = | website = }} '''Alfredo Darrington Bowman''' (26 November 1933 – 6 August 2016), better known as '''Dr. Sebi''', ({{IPAc-en|s|eɪ|b|iː}}){{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=1YU2u3E8sfsC&pg=PA107 |title=Delights of the Garden vegetarian resourcebook, 1996, Washington, DC. |editor=Delights of the Garden (Restaurant) |page=107 |year=1995 |publisher=Four Winds Press |isbn=9780964128415}} was a Honduran herbalist and self-proclaimed healer. Bowman claimed to cure all disease with [[herbalism|herbs]] and a unique [[veganism|vegan]] [[Diet (nutrition)|diet]] based on various pseudoscience claims. His diet was based on the discredited [[alkaline diet]].{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=00TqblVuIisC&pg=PP8 |title=Alkaline Foods Cookbook: Cooking for health and longevity, The best in Vegetarian Cuisines using Non-hybrid and Alkaline foods|year=2013|isbn=9781479783540|author=Exum, Keith}} His beliefs on the origin of disease denied [[Germ theory denialism|germ theory]] and taught that [[HIV/AIDS denialism|HIV is not the cause of AIDS]],{{cite magazine|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DY5dAAAAMAAJ&q=dr+sebi&dq=dr+sebi&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiX1tbv1rPOAhUJFR4KHQ8gD_I4FBDoAQghMAE |title=[unknown] |magazine=First Hand |volume=8 |issue=5 |page=69 |year=1998 |accessdate=9 August 2016}} and factored in faux-[[Afrocentrism|afrocentric]]{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=81ezCwAAQBAJ&pg=SA7-PA27 |title=I am Moor We R Moors |editor=Moor-X Bey-El, Israel |page=56 |year=2015 |isbn=9780993390302}} claims about the unique genetic characteristics of Africans and its diaspora.{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=rCCKUMcxE_cC&pg=PA71 |title=From The Hood To The Holy Land And Back Plus More |author=Rowland, Robert J. |page=71 |year=2009 |isbn=9781462803279}}{{cite web|url=http://rollingout.com/2016/08/07/famed-healer-dr-sebi-dies-suspicious-arrest-hospitalization/ |title=Famed healer Dr. Sebi dies after suspicious arrest and hospitalization |editor=Barnes, Mo |date=7 August 2016 |publisher=Rolling Out |accessdate=9 August 2016}} Although he used the name ''Dr.'' Sebi, Bowman was not a doctor and was considered a [[quackery|quack]] by actual doctors, attorneys, and consumer protection agencies. ==Biography== ===Early years=== Bowman was born in Ilanga, Honduras. He first learned of herbal healing from his grandmother. Bowman moved to the United States {{When|date=February 2018}} and, according to his literature, was dissatisfied with traditional medical practices in treating his asthma, diabetes, and [[erectile dysfunction|impotency]]. After visits to Mexico to see an herbalist,{{who|date=February 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.voice-online.co.uk/article/famed-herbal-healer-dr-sebi-dies-police-custody |title=Famed Herbal Healer Dr Sebi 'Dies In Police Custody': The 83-year-old claimed to have a cure for AIDS and cancer along with a long list of other related cures |editor=Press |date=8 August 2016 |publisher=The Voice |accessdate=9 August 2016}} whom Bowman claimed healed him, he began an herbal healing practice in New York. ===Career=== He began{{When|date=February 2018}} another practice in Honduras he called the USHA Research Institute in a village called Usha near [[La Ceiba, Honduras]]. Bowman made vast amounts of money, more than $3000 a day, after giving advice to some notable celebrities including [[Lisa Lopes]], [[Steven Seagal]], [[John Travolta]], [[Eddie Murphy]] and [[Michael Jackson]]. After the lawsuits in New York he relocated to [[Los Angeles, California]]. ===Arrest and death controversy=== Bowman was arrested for [[money laundering]] in March 2016 while attempting to transfer from a plane from the United States to a private plane at the [[Juan Manuel Gálvez International Airport|Juan Manuel Gálvez de Roatan Airport]] while carrying $37,000 in cash. On 28 May 2016 he was arrested again carrying $50,000 and taken into custody.{{cite web|url=http://thesource.com/2016/08/08/dr-sebi-dies-in-police-custody-in-honduras/ |title=Dr. Sebi Dies In Police Custody In Honduras |editor=Polygod |date=8 August 2016 |publisher=The Source |accessdate=9 August 2016}} He was first released pending a court hearing on 6 June 2016, only to be re-arrested by the Public Ministerio on money laundering charges. He was held for several weeks in a Honduran prison as his family was attempting to obtain his release and subsequently died en route to [[Hospital Vicente D'Antoni|Hospital D'Antoni]] on 6 August 2016 due to complications of [[pneumonia]] after police officials realized the severity of his health.{{cite web|url=http://rollingout.com/2016/08/07/famed-healer-dr-sebi-dies-suspicious-arrest-hospitalization/ |title=Famed healer Dr. Sebi dies after suspicious arrest and hospitalization |editor=Barnes, Mo |date=7 August 2016 |publisher=Rolling Out |accessdate=19 January 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://chicagodefender.com/2016/08/15/no-mainstream-farewell-for-dr-sebi/ |title=No Mainstream Farewell for Dr.Sebi |editor=EL' Zabar, Kai |date=15 August 2016 |publisher=Chicago Defender |accessdate=19 January 2017}} {{cite web|url=http://www.theroot.com/5-mysteries-surrounding-the-life-and-death-of-dr-sebi-1790856373 |title=5 Mysteries Surrounding the Life and Death of Dr. Sebi |editor=Crockett Jr., Stephen A. |date=11 August 2016 |publisher=The Root |accessdate=19 January 2017}} The length of his time in custody and the condition of the jail may have contributed to his death. There is a conspiracy theory believed by some among his followers who question his arrest and death claiming that there was a conspiracy to silence him because his teachings [[Big Pharma conspiracy theory|differed from the medical establishment]]. ==Personal life== Bowman considered himself an [[Africa]]n, not an "[[Afro-Hondurans|African-Honduran]]", but an African ''in'' Honduras.{{cite web |url=http://www.sojourntohonduras.com/Pages/Preview.aspx |title=Chapter 8 Alfredo Bowman is Dr. Sebi The Healer |publisher=Sojourn to Honduras |accessdate=9 August 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160826082553/http://www.sojourntohonduras.com/Pages/Preview.aspx |archive-date=2016-08-26 |dead-url=yes |df= }} At the time of his death, he had seventeen living children. His maternal grandfather was from [[Haiti]].{{cite AV media |people=Dr. Sebi |year= 2014 |title=Conversation With Dr. Sebi, Speaks About Haitians and Haiti |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NYiTZkkZYks |accessdate=9 August 2016 |editor=Andy B. |location=La Cieba, Honduras |publisher=YouTube}} ==Lawsuits== In 1987, New York City charged him with a criminal charge of [[practicing medicine without a license]]. It was recognized that "Dr. Sebi" was not a physician, he was acquitted because jurors claimed the state failed to show he made a medical diagnosis.{{cite news |last=Jamison |first=Harold L |date=October 1, 1988 |title=Herbalist found not guilty in ‘fake’ healing case |newspaper=New York Amsterdam News |url=http://www.naturallifeenergy.com/documents/sebi-found-not-guilty.pdf |dead-url=no |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150404061520/http://www.naturallifeenergy.com/documents/sebi-found-not-guilty.pdf |archive-date=2015-04-04 |access-date=16 February 2018 }} He was later sued by the New York Attorney General for [[consumer fraud]] and prevented from making therapeutic claims for his products.{{Cite web|url=https://www.quackwatch.org/11Ind/sebi/nyag_testimony.pdf|title=Hearing on Dietary Supplements. Before the House Committee on Government Operations Subcommittee on Human Resources and Intergovernmental Relations, July 20, 1993, pp 106-110.|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} ===People of the State of New York v. Ogun Herbal Research Institute=== At a 1993 Congressional hearing, Shirley Stark, who headed the NYAG's Consumer Fraud Section, indicated that a civil suit against Bowman's company had been successful, stating:
''"A particularly glaring example of unsubstantiated therapeutic claims made for herbal supplements occurred a few years ago when the USHA Herbal Research Institute, run by a self-styled nutritionist calling himself "Dr. Sebi," advertised in the Village Voice and the Amsterdam News that "AIDS HAS BEEN CURED" by USHA and that they also specialize in cures for Leukemia, sickle cell anemia, herpes, lupus and other diseases. For an initial fee of $500 and $80 for each additional visit, patients were told they could be cured of AIDS and other diseases. The "cures" consisted of various herbal products, for each of which USHA made therapeutic claims. Eva Therapeutic Salve, for example, was referred to in USHA's brochure as . . . "very effective on major skin problems, in prenatal use, against poor circulation, cancer, cysts, hemorrhoids and arthritis." In fact, these claims were false. Our office filed suit against USHA and entered a consent agreement under which USHA can no longer make therapeutic claims for any of its products"''{{Cite web|url=http://www.quackwatch.org/11Ind/sebi/nyag_testimony.pdf|title=Statement of Shirley Stark Assistant Attorney General of New York before the House Committee on Government Operations Subcommittee on Human Resources and Intergovernmental Realations on Dietary Supplements|page=108|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}
The consent judgement prohibits the Ogun Herbal Research Institute ([[Trade name|d/b/a]] "USHA"), Fig Tree Products Company, Alfredo Bowman, Maa Bowman, and their successors, heirs and assigns from (i) claiming that their products or services could cure, relieve or alter in any way the course of AIDS, herpes, leukemia, sickle cell anemia, lupus, or any other human disease or physical condition, (ii) distributing or advertising such products, and (iii) diagnosing, treating or prescribing for any human disease without a valid state license by the [[New York State Education Department]]. A sum of $900 for costs was assessed to the defendants.{{cite web|url=http://www.casewatch.org/ag/ny/usha/consent_1988.pdf|title=Supreme Court of the State of New York (New York County), Index No. 40396/87 (pg. 1-10), Filed June 28, 1988|publisher=}} ===Alfredo Bowman and Dr. Sebi LLC v. Michael Jackson=== In 2004, Bowman claims that he was not paid in full for an alleged treatment for Michael Jackson to help him overcome painkiller addiction to [[Pethidine|Demerol]] and [[morphine]] with his ''African Bio-Electric Cell Food Therapy,'' which apparently lasted six months at an [[Aspen, Colorado|Aspen]] retreat providing him with "special herb compounds" and trained cooks.{{cite web|url=http://www.quackwatch.org/11Ind/sebi.html |title=A Skeptical Look at the Late "Dr. Sebi" |editor=[[Stephen Barrett|Barrett, Stephen]] (M.D.) |date=16 August 2016 |publisher=Quack Watch |accessdate=19 January 2017}} Bowman claims that $380,000 was outstanding and sought $600,000 in lost revenue of the deferment of clients and various speaking arrangements{{cite web|url=http://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?id=8687&page=archive-read |title=Jackson sued by herbalist |editor=Press |date=15 October 2004 |publisher=The Namibian |accessdate=19 January 2017}} after Jackson's brother Randy only gave him $10,000.{{cite web|url=http://www.femalefirst.co.uk/music/musicnews/Michael+Jackson-628.html |title=Michael Jackson 'sued by herbalist' |editor=Press |publisher=Female First |accessdate=19 January 2017}} Raymone Bain, a publicist of Jackson acknowledges that Bowman was a friend of Jackson but denies that his client received any "professional treatment" or that he had any painkiller addiction.{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/48452/michael-sued-over-alleged-detox |title=Michael Sued over Alleged Detox |editor=Ryan, Joal |date=13 October 2004 |publisher=E! News |accessdate=19 January 2017}} The case was dismissed in 2015 for lack of prosecution.{{cite web|url=http://cdn.digitalcity.com/tmz_documents/mj_lease.pdf|title=Superior Court of the State of California County of Los Angeles - Southwest Judicial District: Docket No. BC322867 (pg. 3), filed Oct 13, 2004|publisher=}} ==See also== *[[Charlatan]] *[[Herbalism]] == References == {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== *{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=kNLtAAAAMAAJ&q=alfredo+bowman&dq=alfredo+bowman&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiG7dmYybPOAhWLGh4KHVxSAA8Q6AEIPjAG |title=The Politics of culture |editor=Williams, Brett |page=148 |year=1991 |accessdate=9 August 2016}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bowman, Alfredo}} [[Category:1933 births]] [[Category:2016 deaths]] [[Category:Alternative detoxification promoters]] [[Category:Death conspiracy theories]] [[Category:People in alternative medicine]] [[Category:Honduran nutritionists]] [[Category:Honduran people of African descent]] [[Category:Honduran people of Haitian descent]] [[Category:Healers]] [[Category:Herbalists]] [[Category:Quacks]] [[Category:Raw foodists]] [[Category:Deaths from pneumonia]] [[Category:Pseudoscientific diet advocates]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 3 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta9)
revision.text:
'''Alkali Lake Chemical Waste Dump''' is a [[hazardous waste]] disposal site near the southwest edge of [[Alkali Lake (Oregon)|Alkali Lake]], a seasonally dry [[Dry lake|playa]] in [[Lake County, Oregon]]. It is in the [[Summer Lake (Oregon)|Summer Lake]] watershed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deq12.deq.state.or.us/fp20/FPDetail.aspx?SiteID=6013|title=Oregon DEQ Facility Profiler 2.0: Site 6013|date=1999-03-31|work=[[Oregon Department of Environmental Quality]]|accessdate=16 March 2010}}</ref> The site has been the focus of [[Oregon Department of Environmental Quality]] (DEQ) efforts to remediate a complex mix of toxic chemicals. Problems were initially caused by the dumping of hazardous waste near the lakebed between 1969 and 1971.
==Description== Beginning in February 1969,<ref name=DEQPCJ2009>Proposed Consent Judgment for Portion of Cleanup Costs at Alkali Lake Facility [http://www.deq.state.or.us/Webdocs/Controls/Output/PdfHandler.ashx?p=ab7ef6d9-06be-4a5b-b080-97bc64bff35b.pdf]</ref> Chemical Waste Storage and Disposition, a [[Beaverton, Oregon|Beaverton]] company, stored roughly 25,000 [[55-gallon drum]]s of chemical waste near the shore of the playa with a permit from the [[Oregon Department of Agriculture]].<ref name="headache" /><ref name="factsheet" /> The drums contained pesticides including [[2,4-D]] and [[MCPA]] herbicide residue containing chlorophenols, polymeric chlorophenoxyphenols and [[dioxin]]s/furans (including [[2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin]]); metallic chloride waste, and paints and paint solvent.<ref>[http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/ecsi/ecsidetail.asp?seqnbr=291#contamination Site Summary Report - Details for Site ID 291, Alkali Lake Disposal Site], Environmental Cleanup Site Information (ECSI) Database, Oregon DEQ, 2012</ref> Chemical Waste Storage was contracted for waste disposal by the Chipman division of Rhodia,<ref name=DEQPCJ2009 /> a [[Portland, Oregon|Portland]] [[herbicide]] manufacturer, and by [[Oregon Metallurgical Corporation]], a [[titanium]] producer.<ref>"PUBLIC COMMENT SOUGHT ON WASTES NEAR LAKEVIEW". The Oregonian: pp. C02. 1993-05-07.</ref> Further shipments were prohibited in 1971, due to improper waste handling practices.<ref name="factsheet" /> The [[Government of Oregon|State of Oregon]] took over the site in 1974, after losing legal actions against Chemical Waste Storage to force their compliance with new hazardous waste laws.<ref name="factsheet" /> First the [[Oregon Circuit Court|Circuit Court]] and then the [[Oregon Court of Appeals|Court of Appeals]] determined that the company was financially unable to comply with the new regulations and that the State was to some extent complicit.<ref name="factsheet" /> In 1976, at a cost of $84,000, the state used bulldozers to push, crush and compact the leaking barrels into a dozen shallow, unlined, 400' long trenches, then covered them with soil.<ref name="headache" /><ref name="Oregonian" />
This trench method was the least expensive option presented to the DEQ, and was chosen against scientific advisors' advice and protest.<ref name="headache" /><ref name="factsheet" /><ref name="Oregonian">{{cite web|url=http://www.oregonlive.com/environment/index.ssf/2009/09/oregons_plans_for_vietnamera_h.html|title=Oregon's plans for Alkali Lake herbicide dump raise concerns|last=Learn|first=Scott|date=September 2, 2009|work=[[The Oregonian]]|accessdate=15 March 2010}}</ref> The [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]]'s regional administrator over the area also opposed the trench remediation.<ref name="headache" /> The state released Chemical Waste Storage's owners from any liability in 1976.<ref name="headache" />
According to the DEQ's 2007 factsheet, water testing results had revealed a subsurface [[Plume (hydrodynamics)|plume]] extending about 2000' to the north-northwest of the dumpsite and covering at least {{convert|50|acre}} has contaminated the shallow [[groundwater]] [[aquifer]] at the site, but according to the DEQ, it has not expanded since their assessment of the area began in 1991.<ref name="factsheet" /><ref name="ra" /> The area is polluted with [[Dioxins and dioxin-like compounds|dioxins]]: the soil contains up to 100 parts per trillion, and nearby groundwater is about 0.4 parts per trillion.<ref name="factsheet" /><ref name="ra">{{cite web|title=Human Health and Ecological Risk Assessment Alkali Lake Chemical Waste Disposal Site Lake County, Oregon|last=Ernst|first=Richard|author2=Taku Fuji|author3=Neil Morton|date=2005-07-26|accessdate=15 March 2010|url=http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/cu/er/AlkaliLake/RiskAssessment.PDF|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723023143/http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/cu/er/AlkaliLake/RiskAssessment.PDF|archive-date=2011-07-23|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> A {{convert|3.9|mi}} fence was installed to prevent grazing [[cattle]] from entering the area. The endangered [[Hutton Springs tui chub]] are only known to live at [[Hutton Spring]], {{convert|1.5|mi}} away.<ref name="factsheet" /><ref name="ra" /> According to the [[United States Fish and Wildlife Service]], "The DEQ has determined that the contaminated plume is spreading from east to west, away from Hutton Spring and thus does not currently constitute a threat to the water quality in Hutton Spring".<ref name="USFWS">{{cite web|url=http://www.fws.gov/oregonfwo/Species/Data/HuttonTuiChub/default.asp|title=Species Fact Sheet: Hutton tui chub|date=October 30, 2009|work=[[U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service]]: Oregon Field Office Website|accessdate=15 March 2010}}</ref> Threatened [[western snowy plover]]s have also been observed at the lake, feeding on [[brine shrimp]].<ref name="headache" /><ref name="ra" /> A low-temperature [[methanogen]] [[extremophile]], ''[[Methanohalophilus|Methanohalophilus oregonense]]'', was found at the dump site in 1989 by David Boone, an [[Oregon Graduate Institute]] scientist.<ref>{{cite news|title=Bacterium lives in hot environs deep beneath surface of Earth|last=Hill|first=Richard L.|date=1997-12-17|work=The Oregonian|pages=D19}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=EXTREME BEINGS|last=Hill|first=Richard L.|date=2001-06-06|work=The Oregonian|pages=B01}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1099/00207713-40-2-111|last=Liu|first=Yitai|author2=David R. Boone |author3=Chee Choy |date=April 1990|title=Methanohalophilus oregonense sp. nov. a Methylotrophic Methanogen from an Alkaline, Saline Aquifer|journal=International Journal of Systematic Bacteriology|publisher=International Union of Microbiological Societies|volume=40|issue=2|pages=111–116}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=LOOKING AT GREENHOUSE FROM A MICROSCOPIC VIEW|last=Gardner|first=Fran|date=1991-06-27|work=The Oregonian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=MICROBE WEARS OREGON LABEL|last=Hill|first=Richard L.|date=1990-03-08|work=The Oregonian|pages=E01}}</ref>
The dumpsite is currently surrounded by [[barbed wire]] and owned by [[Bayer CropScience]], the successor to Rhodia.<ref name="factsheet">{{cite web|url=http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/cu/er/AlkaliLake/FactSheet070501.pdf|title=Fact Sheet: Alkali Lake Chemical Waste Disposal Site|last=Schwarz|first=Bob|date=May 2007|work=[[Oregon Department of Environmental Quality]]|accessdate=15 March 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110723023109/http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/cu/er/AlkaliLake/FactSheet070501.pdf|archive-date=2011-07-23|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> The trenches were recovered with a soil cap in 1993.<ref name="headache" /><ref name="ra" /> The dumpsite is {{convert|10.3|acre}} and contains 50 monitoring wells.<ref name="headache">{{cite news|title=Toxic wastes at Alkali Lake pose headache for state|last=Larabee|first=Mark|date=2004-12-29|work=The Oregonian}}</ref><ref name="ra" /> There are an estimated 800,000 to 1.4 million gallons of toxic waste at the site, and is called one of Oregon's worst toxic-waste dumps by the project manager at the DEQ.<ref name="headache" /> Oregon has paid over $2 million for monitoring and to acquire land surrounding the dump.<ref name="headache" /> While the state of Oregon allocated a special fund for abandoned waste sites in 1991, it specifically does not cover the Alkali Lake site, which comes from the regular budget for DEQ.<ref>{{cite news|title=LEGISLATURE'S 1991 FUND EXCLUDES SOUTHERN OREGON SITE|last=Larabee|first=Mark|date=2004-12-29|work=The Oregonian}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110723023218/http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/cu/er/AlkaliLake/ Alkali Lake] at [[Oregon Department of Environmental Quality]] * [http://www.deq.state.or.us/lq/ECSI/ecsidetail.asp?seqnbr=291 Photo database] at [[Oregon Department of Environmental Quality]] * [http://oaspub.epa.gov/enviro/fii_query_dtl.disp_program_facility?pgm_sys_id_in=ORD980511497&pgm_sys_acrnm_in=RCRAINFO Facility Detail Report] at the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency]] * Location: {{Coord|42|58|3.36|N|120|2|48.84|W|display=inline,title}}<!-- given in DEQ site summary -->
[[Category:Geography of Lake County, Oregon]] [[Category:Environment of Oregon]] [[Category:Pollution in the United States]] [[Category:Hazardous waste]] [[Category:1969 establishments in Oregon]]

{{Infobox person | name = Andrea Fischer | image = Andrea Fischer.JPG | alt = | caption = Andrea Fischer (2000) | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1960|1|14|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Arnsberg]], [[Germany]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = | other_names = | occupation = | years_active = | known_for = | notable_works = }} '''Andrea Fischer''' (born January 14, 1960 in [[Arnsberg]]/Westfalen) was a member of the [[Germany|German]] [[Bundestag]] for the [[German Green Party]] and from 1998 until 2001 Federal Minister for [[Health]]. She dropped out of the Bundestag in 2002. ==Life== ===Education and profession=== After graduating from high school, Andrea Fischer completed an [[apprenticeship]] as an offset printer. She then worked as a [[Offset printing|printer]] and [[proofreader]] and additionally completed her [[Higher education|studies]] in [[economics]] at the [[Free University of Berlin]]. After completing her studies, she worked as a research assistant at the [[European Parliament]], the [[WZB Berlin Social Science Center]] and the ''Federal Insurance Institution for Employees'' ''(Bundesversicherungsanstalt für Angestellte)''. ===Political career=== She has been a member of the [[German Green Party]] since 1985, before that she was a member of the [[Group of International Marxists]] (GIM), the then German section of the Fourth International. From 1994 to 2002 she was a member of the [[German Bundestag]]. After the [[German federal election, 1998|1998 federal elections]], she was appointed [[Federal Ministry of Health (Germany)|Federal Minister of Health]] on 27 October 1998 as a member of the [[Cabinet of Germany|federal government]] headed by [[Gerhard Schröder]]. She [[resigned]] from office on 9 January 2001 in the wake of the [[Bovine spongiform encephalopathy|BSE]] [[crisis]]. Shortly afterwards, the resignation of the [[Federal Ministry of Food and Agriculture (Germany)|Federal Minister of Agriculture]], [[Karl-Heinz Funke]], was also announced. In the film ''Schlachtfeld Politik - Die finstere Seite der Macht'' ({{lang-en|Battlefield Politics - The dark side of power}}) by [[Stephan Lamby]], she describes that there was massive [[pressure]] from the party leadership. The film asks whether Andrea Fischer had to resign after ''[[Joschka Fischer]]'s wild years'' ([[Der Spiegel]] edition 2/2001), not so much because of the [[Bovine spongiform encephalopathy|BSE]] [[crisis]] as to relieve [[Joschka Fischer]].[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uY2Vet3efPc Schlachtfeld Politik], youtube.com Fischer was elected as the leading [[Alliance 90/The Greens]] candidate in the [[Berlin state election, 2011|Berlin election]] on 18 September 2011 in the district assembly ''(Bezirksverordnetenversammlung)'' of Berlin's [[Mitte]] [[Boroughs and neighborhoods of Berlin|borough]], where she was chair of the [[Alliance 90/The Greens]] parliamentary group until 30 October 2012.[[Berliner Woche]]: [http://www.berliner-woche.de/nachrichten/bezirk-mitte/artikel/1122-andrea-fischer-zur-regionsraetin-in-hannover-gewaehlt Andrea Fischer zur Regionsrätin in Hannover gewählt] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140114163811/http://www.berliner-woche.de/nachrichten/bezirk-mitte/artikel/1122-andrea-fischer-zur-regionsraetin-in-hannover-gewaehlt/ |date=2014-01-14 }}, 2. Oktober 2012. On 15 October 2012, Fischer was elected by the [[Regierungsbezirk|Regional Assembly]] to the office of Finance Director of the [[Hanover Region]], which had been restructured by Regional President [[Hauke Jagau]].Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung [http://www.haz.de/Hannover/Aus-der-Stadt/Uebersicht/CDU-Frau-Barbara-Thiel-muss-gehen-Region-sucht-neuen-Dezernenten CDU-Frau Thiel muss gehen], vom 26.09.2014 It manages the areas of finance, facility management and hospitals. In April 2013 she took over as Chairman of the Supervisory Board of the ''Klinikum Region Hanover''.[[Hannoversche Allgemeine Zeitung]]: [http://www.haz.de/Hannover/Aus-der-Stadt/Uebersicht/Region-muss-Klinikum-vor-Pleite-retten Region muss Klinikum vor Pleite retten], vom 5. April 2013 ===Lobbyism=== After her time as an active [[politician]], Fischer became active as a [[freelance]] [[publicist]] and [[lobbyist]] in international health policy. From 2001 to 2009 she was [[patron]] of the ''Federal Association of Experienced Psychiatrists'' ''(Bundesverband Psychiatrie-Erfahrener)''.[http://www.bpe-online.de/verband/vorstandsmitteilungen/schirmherrin-trennung.pdf BPE trennt sich von Schirmherrin Andrea Fischer. Pressemitteilung des BPE vom 19. Januar 2009] (PDF; 84 kB) From 2004 to 2006 Fischer was a member of the management team of the [[consulting]] firm ''Institut für Organisationskommunikation'' (IFOK GmbH), where she was responsible for [[health]] and [[nutrition]]. Previously, she was head of the Center of Canadian Universities (CUC) in [[Berlin]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.cuc-berlin.org/newsletter/issue/1.pdf |title=Archived copy |access-date=2018-06-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930061442/http://www.cuc-berlin.org/newsletter/issue/1.pdf |archive-date=2007-09-30 |dead-url=yes |df= }} Fischer is Vice Chairwoman of the Board of Trustees of the Institute of Man, Ethics and Science ''(Institut Mensch, Ethik und Wissenschaft)''.{{cite web|title=Institut Mensch, Ethik und Wissenschaft|periodical=imew.de|publisher=|url=http://www.imew.de/index.php?id=28|format=|accessdate=2011-06-30|last=|date=|year=|month=|day=|language=German|pages=|quote=}}. From 2006 to 2009 she worked at the [[PR agency]] [[Ketchum Inc.|Pleon]] in [[Munich]], where she headed the medical-pharmaceutical area of healthcare.[http://www.horizont.net/aktuell/leute/pages/protected/Ex-Ministerin-Andrea-Fischer-geht-zu-Pleon_64252.html Andrea Fischer geht zu Pleon], abgerufen am 16. November 2012 Since then she has been self-employed in this field.[http://www.andrea-fischer.de/de/profil/curriculum-vitae/index.shtml Curriculum Vitae von Andrea Fischer], abgerufen am 16. November 2012 Since April 2006, Fischer has been co-editor of ''GesundheitsNachrichten'', a specialist journal for the health industry.DWDL: ''[http://www.dwdl.de/article/news_6582,00.html "GesundheitsNachrichten" von Ex-Ministerin Fischer]''. 6. April 2006 ===Journalism=== From October 2002 to the end of 2003, Andrea Fischer and [[BamS]] [[editor-in-chief]] [[Claus Strunz]] hosted the [[n-tv]] programme ''[[Grüner Salon]]''.{{Cite web |url=http://www.zdf.de/ZDFde/inhalt/29/0,1872,2034973,00.html |title=Archived copy |access-date=2018-06-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030401082410/http://www.zdf.de/ZDFde/inhalt/29/0,1872,2034973,00.html |archive-date=2003-04-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }} She appears regularly in broadcasts on [[Deutschlandradio Kultur]], where she presents new publications of German-language crime literature. ===Other commitments=== Fischer supported the [[Berlin]] [[Pro-Reli]] [[Political campaign|campaign]], which failed in April 2009, as a [[testimonial]]. Since 2008 she has been the [[diocesan]] leader of the [[Malteser Hilfsdienst]] in [[Berlin]].[http://www.morgenpost.de/printarchiv/berlin/article976163/Ehemalige-Ministerin-wird-Malteser-Chefin.html Bericht auf morgenpost.de vom 12. November 2008] ===Religion=== As a young woman, Fischer left the [[Catholic Church]], into which she rejoined a good twenty years later.Ulrich Schnabel: [http://www.zeit.de/2004/01/Glauben_i__Dland?page=all ''Wie man in Deutschland glaubt.''] In: ''Die Zeit.'' 22. Dezember 2003. ==Publications== *Andrea Fischer: ''Was glaubst denn du?: Die Menschen und der liebe Gott.'' Goldmann HC, 2008, {{ISBN|978-3-442-31163-7}}. *Andrea Fischer, Rainer Sibbel (Hrsg.): ''Der Patient als Kunde und Konsument. Wie viel Patientensouveränität ist möglich?'' Gabler Verlag, Wiesbaden 2011, {{ISBN|978-3-8349-2056-0}}. ----
'''[[Bundesministerium für Gesundheit und Soziale Sicherung|Gesundheitsminister]] of the [[Bundesrepublik Deutschland]]''':
[[Elisabeth Schwarzhaupt]] | [[Käte Strobel]] | [[Katharina Focke]] | [[Antje Huber]] | [[Anke Fuchs]] | [[Heiner Geißler]] | [[Rita Süssmuth]] | [[Ursula Lehr]] | [[Gerda Hasselfeldt]] | [[Horst Seehofer]] | Andrea Fischer | [[Ulla Schmidt]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *{{official website|www.andrea-fischer.de}} {{de icon}} *{{IMDb name|id=nm1999587}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fischer, Andrea}} [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alliance 90/The Greens politicians]] [[Category:Health ministers of Germany]] [[Category:People from Arnsberg]] [[Category:Women federal government ministers of Germany]] [[Category:Female members of the Bundestag]] [[Category:20th-century women politicians]] [[Category:21st-century women politicians]] {{Germany-Greens-politician-stub}}

{{Medref|date=November 2013}} '''Auditory verbal agnosia''' ('''AVA'''), also known as '''pure word deafness''', is the inability to comprehend speech. Individuals with this disorder lose the ability to understand language, repeat words, and write from dictation. Some patients with AVA describe hearing spoken language as meaningless noise, often as though the person speaking was doing so in a foreign language.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.udallas.edu/udjs/departments/psychology/2013-2014/auditory-verbal-agnosia.php|title=Auditory Verbal Agnosia|last=Guilbeau|first=Catherine|date=December 16, 2017|website=University of Dallas|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> However, spontaneous speaking, reading, and writing are preserved. The maintenance of the ability to process non-speech auditory information, including music, also remains relatively more intact than spoken language comprehension.<ref name=":0">{{Cite journal|last=Poeppel|first=David|date=2001-09-01|title=Pure word deafness and the bilateral processing of the speech code|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1207/s15516709cog2505_3/abstract|journal=Cognitive Science|language=en|volume=25|issue=5|pages=679–693|doi=10.1207/s15516709cog2505_3|issn=1551-6709}}</ref> Individuals who exhibit pure word deafness are also still able to recognize non-verbal sounds.<ref name=Wolberg>{{cite journal|vauthors=Wolberg SC, Temlett JA, Fritz VU |title=Pure word deafness |journal=S. Afr. Med. J. |volume=78 |issue=11 |pages=668–70 |date=December 1990 |pmid=2251612 |doi= }}</ref> The ability to interpret language via [[lip reading]], hand gestures, and context clues is preserved as well.<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal|last=Wirkowski|first=Ela|last2=Echausse|first2=Nancy|last3=Overby|first3=Chris|last4=Ortiz|first4=Orlando|last5=Radler|first5=Linda|title=I can hear you yet cannot comprehend: A case of pure word deafness|url=https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jemermed.2005.03.016|journal=The Journal of Emergency Medicine|volume=30|issue=1|pages=53–55|doi=10.1016/j.jemermed.2005.03.016|year=2006}}</ref> Sometimes, this [[agnosia]] is preceded by [[cortical deafness]]; however, this is not always the case. Researchers have documented that in most patients exhibiting auditory verbal agnosia, the discrimination of consonants is more difficult than that of vowels, but as with most neurological disorders, there is variation among patients.<ref>{{cite journal |vauthors=Ackermann H, Mathiak K |title=[Symptomatology, Neuroanatomlcal Correlates and Pathomechanisms of Central Hearing Disorders (Pure Word Deafness, Verbal/Nonverbal Auditory Agnosia, Cortical Deafness) A Review] |journal=Fortschr Neurol Psychiatr |volume=67 |issue=11 |pages=509–23 |date=November 1999 |pmid=10598334 |doi=10.1055/s-2007-995228 |url=}}</ref>
Auditory verbal agnosia (AVA) is not the same as '''[[auditory agnosia]]'''; patients with (nonverbal) auditory agnosia have a relatively more intact speech comprehension system despite their impaired recognition of nonspeech sounds.<ref name=":0" />
==Presentation== Auditory verbal agnosia can be referred to as a [[Aphasia|pure aphasia]] because it has a high degree of specificity. Despite an inability to comprehend speech, patients with auditory verbal agnosia typically retain the ability to hear and process non-speech auditory information, speak, read and write. This specificity suggests that there is a separation between speech perception, non-speech auditory processing, and central language processing.<ref name=":0" /> In support of this theory, there are cases in which speech and non-speech processing impairments have responded differentially to treatment. For example, some therapies have improved writing comprehension in patients over time, while speech remained critically impaired in those same patients.
The term "pure word deafness" is something of a misnomer. By definition, individuals with pure word deafness are not deaf – in the absence of other impairments, these individuals have normal hearing for all sounds, including speech. The term "deafness" originates from the fact that individuals with AVA are unable to ''comprehend'' speech that they hear. The term "pure word" refers to the fact that comprehension of verbal information is selectively impaired in AVA. For this reason, AVA is distinct from other [[auditory agnosia]]s in which the recognition of nonspeech sounds is impaired. [[Auditory agnosia|Classical (or pure) auditory agnosia]] is an inability to process environmental sounds. [[Auditory agnosia|Interpretive or receptive agnosia]] (amusia) is an inability to understand music.
Patients with pure word deafness complain that speech sounds simply do not register, or that they tend not to come up. Other claims include speech sounding as if it were in a foreign language, the words having a tendency to run together, or the feeling that speech was simply not connected to the patient's voice.<ref name=":0" /> ==Causes== Auditory verbal agnosia has been shown to form as a result of tumor formation, especially in the posterior third ventricle, trauma, lesions, [[cerebral infarction]], encephalitis as a result of herpes simplex, and Landaui-Kleffner syndrome.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Shivashankar|first=N|last2=Shashikala|first2=H.R|last3=Nagaraja|first3=D|last4=Jayakumar|first4=P.N|last5=Ratnavalli|first5=E|title=Pure word deafness in two patients with subcortical lesions|url=https://doi.org/10.1016/S0303-8467(01)00136-6|journal=Clinical Neurology and Neurosurgery|volume=103|issue=4|pages=201–205|doi=10.1016/s0303-8467(01)00136-6|year=2001}}</ref> <ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Kasselimis|first=Dimitrios S.|last2=Angelopoulou|first2=Georgia|last3=Kolovos|first3=Georgios|last4=Daskalaki|first4=Argyro|last5=Peppas|first5=Christos|last6=Tavernarakis|first6=Antonios|last7=Potagas|first7=Constantin|title=Pure word deafness due to herpes simplex encephalitis|url=https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jns.2016.11.018|journal=Journal of the Neurological Sciences|volume=372|pages=11–13|doi=10.1016/j.jns.2016.11.018|year=2017}}</ref> The exact location of damage which results in pure word deafness is still under debate, but the planum temporale, posterior STG, and white matter damage to the [[Acoustic radiation|acoustic radiations]] (AR) have all been implicated.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Maffei|first=Chiara|last2=Capasso|first2=Rita|last3=Cazzolli|first3=Giulia|last4=Colosimo|first4=Cesare|last5=Dell'Acqua|first5=Flavio|last6=Piludu|first6=Francesca|last7=Catani|first7=Marco|last8=Miceli|first8=Gabriele|title=Pure word deafness following left temporal damage: Behavioral and neuroanatomical evidence from a new case|url=https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cortex.2017.10.006|journal=Cortex|volume=97|pages=240–254|doi=10.1016/j.cortex.2017.10.006|year=2017}}</ref>
Auditory verbal agnosia is rarely diagnosed in its pure form. Auditory verbal agnosia can both present as the result of acute damage or as chronic, progressive degeneration over time. Cases have been documented that result from severe acute head trauma resulting in bilateral temporal lobe damage.<ref name=":1" /> In contrast, auditory verbal agnosia has also been documented to present progressively over several years. In one such case, the patient exhibited progressive word deafness over a 9-year period but did not exhibit any other cognitive of mental deterioration. [[MRI]]s showed cortical atrophy in the left superior temporal lobe region.<ref name="Otsuki 1998" />
In childhood, auditory verbal agnosia can also be caused by [[Landau-Kleffner syndrome]], also called acquired epileptic aphasia. It is often the first symptom of this disease.<ref name="Metz-Lutz 2009">{{Cite journal|last1=Metz-Lutz|first1=MN.|date=Aug 2009|title=The assessment of auditory function in CSWS: lessons from long-term outcome.|journal=Epilepsia|volume=50 Suppl 7|issue=|pages=73–6|doi=10.1111/j.1528-1167.2009.02225.x|PMID=19682057}}</ref> A review of 45 cases suggested a relationship between prognosis and age of onset with poorer prognosis for those with earlier onset.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Tharpe|first=Anne|year=1991|title=Diagnostic and Management Considerations of Acquired Epileptic Aphasia or Landau-Kleffner Syndrome|journal=The American Journal of Otology|volume=12}}</ref> In extremely rare cases, auditory verbal agnosia has been known to present as a symptom of [[Neurodegeneration|neurodegenerative disease]], such as [[Alzheimer's disease]].<ref>{{cite journal|date=December 2011|title=Pure word deafness in a patient with early-onset Alzheimer's disease: an unusual presentation|url=|journal=J Clin Neurol|volume=7|issue=4|pages=227–30|doi=10.3988/jcn.2011.7.4.227|pmc=3259498|pmid=22259620|vauthors=Kim SH, Suh MK, Seo SW, Chin J, Han SH, Na DL}}</ref> In such cases auditory verbal agnosia is a symptom that is typically followed by more severe neurological symptoms typical of Alzheimer's disease.
==Diagnosis== {{expand section |section only describes intact abilities but no specification of deficits|date=November 2013}} There is no uniform performance among patients with auditory verbal agnosia; therefore it is not possible to attribute specific phonetic or phonological deficits to the syndrome.<ref name=":0" /> In order to diagnose AVA, two intact abilities need to be established: * Words that are heard must have undergone adequate acoustic analysis as evidenced by correct repetition;<ref name = Ellis>{{cite book|last=Ellis|first=A.W.|title=c|year=1996|publisher=Psychology Press|location=East Sussex, UK}}</ref> * The semantic representation of the word must be intact as evidenced by immediate comprehension of the word when presented in written form.<ref name = Ellis/> If both of these criteria are met ''and'' lack of auditory verbal comprehension is apparent, a diagnosis of AVA may follow.
In at least one instance, the [[Boston Diagnostic Aphasia Examination]] has been used to profile AVA. This method was able to show that the patient experienced marked difficulty in speech perception with minor to no minor deficits in production, reading, and writing, fitting the profile of AVA. <ref name=":2">{{Cite journal|date=2011-01-01|title=Speech perception, rapid temporal processing, and the left hemisphere: A case study of unilateral pure word deafness|url=|journal=Neuropsychologia|volume=49|issue=2|pages=216–230|doi=10.1016/j.neuropsychologia.2010.11.009|issn=0028-3932|author=Slevc L. Robert|pmc=3031136}}</ref> While this provides a well-known example, other verbal-audio test batteries can and have also been used to diagnose pure speech deafness.
===Cognitive deficits=== Auditory verbal agnosia is the inability to distinguish phonemes.<ref name="Wolberg" /> In some patients with unilateral auditory verbal agnosia, there is evidence that the ability to acoustically process speech signals is affected at the prephonemic level, preventing the conversion of these signals into phonemes.<ref name="Wang Peach 2000">{{cite journal|last1=Wang|first1=Emily|last2=Peach|first2=Richard K.|last3=Xu|first3=Yi|last4=Schneck|first4=Michael|last5=Manry|first5=Charles|title=Perception of Dynamic Acoustic Patterns by an Individual with Unilateral Verbal Auditory Agnosia|journal=Brain and Language| volume=73|issue=3| year=2000|pages=442–455|doi=10.1006/brln.2000.2319}}</ref> There are two predominate hypotheses that address what happens within the language center of the brain in people that have AVA. One of the hypotheses is that an early stage of auditory analysis is impaired. The fact that AVA patients have the ability to read shows that both the semantic system and the speech output lexicon are intact. The second hypotheses suggests that there is either a complete or partial disconnection of the auditory input lexicon from the semantic system. This would suggest that entries in the lexicon can still be activated but they cannot go on to cause subsequent semantic activation.<ref>{{cite book|last=Ellis|first=A.W.|title=Human Cognitive Neuropsychology|year=1996|publisher=Psychology Press|location=East Sussex, Uk}}</ref> In relation to these two different hypotheses, researchers in one study differentiated between two different types of AVA.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Simons|first=Jon S.|author2=Matthew A. Lambon Ralph|title=The Auditory Agnosias|journal=Neurocase|year=1999|volume=5|pages=379–406|url=http://www.memlab.psychol.cam.ac.uk/pubs/Simons1999%20Neurocase.pdf|accessdate=15 November 2013|doi=10.1080/13554799908402734}}</ref> According to this study, one form of AVA is a deficit at the prephonemic level and is related to the inability to comprehend rapid changes in sound.This form of AVA is associated with bilateral temporal lobe lesions. Speech perception in patients with this form of AVA has been shown to improve significantly in understanding when the pace of speech is drastically slowed.<ref name=":0" /> The second type of AVA that the study discusses is a deficit in linguistic discrimination that does not adhere to a prephonemic pattern. This form is associated with left unilateral temporal lobe lesions and may even be considered a form of Wernicke's aphasia. Often individuals diagnosed with auditory verbal agnosia are also incapable of discriminating between non-verbal sounds as well as speech. The underlying problem seems to be temporal in that understanding speech requires the discrimination between specific sounds which are closely spaced in time.<ref name="Stefanatos 2005">{{cite journal |vauthors=Stefanatos GA, Gershkoff A, Madigan S |title=On pure word deafness, temporal processing, and the left hemisphere |journal=Journal of the International Neuropsychological Society : JINS |volume=11 |issue=4 |pages=456–70; discussion 455 |year=2005 |pmid=16209426 |doi=}}</ref> Note that this is not unique to speech; studies using non-speech sounds closely spaced in time (dog bark, phone ring, lightning, etc.) have shown that those with auditory verbal agnosia are unable to discriminate between those sounds in the majority of cases, though a few putative examples of speech-specific impairment have been documented in the literature.
===Neurological deficits=== Auditory verbal agnosia is caused by bilateral damage, often in the form of cerebrovascular accidents which form as a result of an [[embolism]], to the posterior superior [[temporal lobe]]s or disruption of connections between these areas.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Buchman|first=A. S.|last2=Garron|first2=D. C.|last3=Trost-Cardamone|first3=J. E.|last4=Wichter|first4=M. D.|last5=Schwartz|first5=M.|date=1986-05-01|title=Word deafness: one hundred years later.|url=http://jnnp.bmj.com/content/49/5/489|journal=Journal of Neurology, Neurosurgery & Psychiatry|language=en|volume=49|issue=5|pages=489–499|doi=10.1136/jnnp.49.5.489|issn=0022-3050|pmid=2423648|pmc=1028802}}</ref> A unilateral lesion in the left or right superior temporal lobe can also result in pure word deafness, this being much more common in the left hemisphere than the right.<ref name=":3">{{Cite journal|last=Roberts|first=M.|last2=Sandercock|first2=P.|last3=Ghadiali|first3=E.|date=1987-12-01|title=Pure word deafness and unilateral right temporo-parietal lesions: a case report.|url=http://jnnp.bmj.com/content/50/12/1708|journal=Journal of Neurology, Neurosurgery & Psychiatry|language=en|volume=50|issue=12|pages=1708–1709|doi=10.1136/jnnp.50.12.1708|issn=0022-3050|pmid=3437316|pmc=1032628}}</ref> It is often associated with lesions to the left posterior superior temporal lobe, but no such unilateral case has yet been documented without damage to the white matter tract connecting superior temporal lobes bilaterally or bilateral damage to the superior temporal lobe. In cases where unilateral damage to the left superior temporal lobe has been documented, patients exhibited problems processing both speech and non-speech sounds (in other words, not typical of auditory verbal agnosia).<ref name="Stefanatos 2005" /> These facts, in combination with the existence of cases of damage to these white matter tracts without detectable cortical damage, in combination with cases of pure word deafness resulting enlargement of the [[third ventricle]] alone suggest that the disorder results from damage to the left-right superior temporal circuit rather than the superior temporal area on one hemisphere or the other.
Many of the bilateral cases share one essential feature: after the first (unilateral) lesion, speech perception was typically intact after an initial period of disturbance. Only after the second lesion (in the other hemisphere) were permanent speech perception problems the consistent outcome. The fact that most of these patients only manifested auditory verbal agnosia subsequent to the second lesion supports the hypothesis that both sides of the superior temporal gyrus are necessary.<ref name=":0" />
Auditory verbal agnosia is rarely diagnosed in its pure form. Auditory verbal agnosia can present as the result of acute damage or chronic, [[Primary progressive aphasia|progressive degeneration]] over time. Cases have been documented that result from severe acute head trauma resulting in bilateral temporal lobe damage.<ref name=":1" /> In contrast, auditory verbal agnosia has also been documented to present progressively over several years. In one such case, the patient exhibited progressive word deafness over a 9-year period but did not exhibit any other cognitive of mental deterioration. This patient was found, using MRIs, to have cortical atrophy in the left superior temporal lobe region.<ref name="Otsuki 1998">{{cite journal|year=1998|title=Slowly progressive pure word deafness|url=|journal=Eur. Neurol.|volume=39|issue=3|pages=135–40|doi=10.1159/000007923|pmid=9605389|vauthors=Otsuki M, Soma Y, Sato M, Homma A, Tsuji S}}</ref>
==Treatments==
===Sign language therapy=== [[Sign language]] therapy has been identified as one of the top five most common treatments for auditory verbal agnosia. This type of therapy is most useful because, unlike other treatment methods, it does not rely on fixing the damaged areas of the brain. This is particularly important with AVA cases because it has been so hard to identify the causes of the agnosia in the first place, much less treat those areas directly. Sign language therapy, then, allows the person to cope and work around the disability, much in the same way it helps deaf people. In the beginning of therapy, most will work on identifying key objects and establishing an initial core vocabulary of signs. After this, the patient graduates to expand the vocabulary to intangible items or items that are not in view or present. Later, the patient learns single signs and then sentences consisting of two or more signs. In different cases, the sentences are first written down and then the patient is asked to sign them and speak them simultaneously.<ref>Doyle, Patrick J., and Audrey L. Holland. Clinical Management of Patient with Pure Word Deafness. Veterans Administration Medical Center and University of Pittsburgh, n.d. Web. 5 Nov. 2013.</ref> Because different AVA patients vary in the level of speech or comprehension they have, sign language therapy learning order and techniques are very specific to the individual's needs.
=== Tumor Removal === In incidents where tumors and their pressure effects are the cause of pure word deafness, removal of the tumor has been shown to allow for the return of most auditory verbal comprehension.<ref>{{Cite journal|date=2001-12-01|title=Pure word deafness in two patients with subcortical lesions|url=https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0303846701001366|journal=Clinical Neurology and Neurosurgery|volume=103|issue=4|pages=201–205|doi=10.1016/S0303-8467(01)00136-6|issn=0303-8467|author=Shivashankar N, Shashikala H.R, Nagaraja D, Jayakumar P.N, Ratnavalli E}}</ref>
=== Treatments used for Landau-Kleffner syndrome === {{main|Landau-Kleffner syndrome#Treatment}}
====Intravenous immunoglobulin therapy==== Treating auditory verbal agnosia with [[intravenous immunoglobulin]] (IVIG) is controversial because of its inconsistency as a treatment method. Although IVIG is normally used to treat immune diseases, some individuals with auditory verbal agnosia have responded positively to the use of IVIG.<ref name="Mikati 2005">{{Cite journal | last1 = Mikati | first1 = MA. | last2 = Shamseddine | first2 = AN. | title = Management of Landau-Kleffner syndrome. | journal = Paediatr Drugs | volume = 7 | issue = 6 | pages = 377–89 | year = 2005 | doi = 10.2165/00148581-200507060-00006| PMID = 16356025 }}</ref> Additionally, patients are more likely to relapse when treated with IVIG than other pharmacological treatments. IVIG is, thus, a controversial treatment as its efficacy in treating auditory verbal agnosia is dependent upon each individual and varies from case to case.
====Diazepam therapy==== In a study conducted by Masaaki Nagafuchi et al. (1993), a 7-year-old girl began taking a dose of 2 mg [[diazepam]] orally every day. She demonstrated major improvements in behavior and comprehension of speech while under diazepam therapy. Within a month, conversation problems were eliminated. After a year of therapy, her repetition ability was almost normal. After two years, her ability to discriminate monosyllabic words was within the normal range. Her audiological recognition had remained normal from the time of onset (i.e., she could recognize familiar noises such as a baby crying or a telephone ringing).<ref name="Nagafuchi">{{cite journal|first1=M.|last1= Nagafuchi|first2= K.|last2= Iinuma|first3= K.|last3= Yamamoto|first4= T.|last4= Kitahara |title=Diazepam Therapy of Verbal Auditory Agnosia|journal=Brain and Language|volume =45|issue =2|year= 1993| pages =180–188|doi=10.1006/brln.1993.1042}}</ref>

revision.text:
A '''''bayakou''''' is a [[Manual labour|manual laborer]] who works to empty the [[fecal sludge]] out of [[pit latrines]] in [[Haiti]], especially in larger cities, such as [[Port-au-Prince]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://lenouvelliste.com/lenouvelliste/article/137028/Bayakou.html|title=Bayakou|last=|first=|date=15 October 2014|work=Le Nouvelliste|access-date=2017-07-30|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=French}}</ref> The word ''bayakou'' comes from [[Haitian Creole]].<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=aOichD5n92QC&lpg=PA81&dq=BAYAKOU&pg=PA81#v=onepage&q=BAYAKOU&f=false|title=A Promise in Haiti: A Reporter's Notes on Families and Daily Lives|last=Curnutte|first=Mark|publisher=Vanderbilt University Press|year=2011|isbn=9780826517852|location=Nashville, Tennessee|pages=81}}</ref><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Rp48dT5eix8C&lpg=PA149&dq=BAYAKOU&pg=PA149#v=onepage&q=BAYAKOU&f=false|title=English Haitian Creole Dictionary|last=Vilsaint|first=Féquière|last2=Berret|first2=Jean-Evens|publisher=Educa Vision Inc.|year=2005|isbn=9781584322139|edition=2nd|location=Cocunut Creek, Florida|pages=149}}</ref> ''Bayakou'' are subjected to [[social stigma]] for their work in manually emptying [[septic tanks]] and pit latrines.<ref name=":5">{{Cite news|url=https://www.voanews.com/a/dirty-job-shows-why-cholera-kills-haiti/3654586.html|title=Dirty Job Shows Why Cholera Still Kills in Haiti|last=|first=|date=28 December 2016|work=VOA|access-date=2017-07-30|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref>
The more general term used for this kind of undignified practice, particularly in India, is "[[manual scavenging]]". Proper emptying of pit latrines is part of a city-wide [[fecal sludge management]] concept.
== Background == [[Port-au-Prince]] is one of the largest cities in the world without a [[Sewerage|sewer system]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2013/01/29/150501695/port-au-prince-a-city-of-millions-with-no-sewer-system|title=Port-Au-Prince: A City Of Millions, With No Sewer System|last=Knox|first=Richard|date=13 April 2012|work=NPR|access-date=2017-07-30|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> Sinks, showers and toilets have no connection to a central [[sewage treatment plant]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/29/537945957/you-probably-dont-want-to-know-about-haitis-sewage-problems|title=You Probably Don't Want To Know About Haiti's Sewage Problems|last=Hersher|first=Rebecca|date=29 July 2017|work=NPR|access-date=2017-07-30|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> Most of the city uses [[septic tanks]] and [[pit latrines]].<ref name=":0" /> Port-au-Prince finally opened its first sewage treatment plant, Morne a Cabrit, in 2012 with a second, unfinished plant mostly abandoned.<ref name=":1" />
==Description== Because of the lack of infrastructure for [[sewage]] removal, the city turns to other means. The ''bayakou'' in Port-au-Prince are paid to come annually to empty the pits of full pit latrines.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/11/26/opinion/26wilentz.html|title=In Haiti, Waiting for the Grand Bayakou|last=Wilentz|first=Amy|date=2010-11-25|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-07-30|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
''Bayakou'' use plastic buckets to empty pit latrines during the night.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.newyorker.com/tech/elements/haitis-shadow-sanitation-system|title=Haiti’s Shadow Sanitation System|last=Katz|first=Jonathan M.|date=12 March 2014|website=The New Yorker|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-07-30}}</ref> The bayakou work as a crew. One part of the bayakou team climbs through the toilet's squat hole into the pit under the latrine and fills the bucket.<ref name=":2" /> Then the person in the pit hands the bucket up to another crew-member.<ref name=":2" /> The [[human waste]] is put into sacks and placed into a [[wheelbarrow]] which a third person carts away.<ref name=":5" /> The waste is normally dumped on the ground, ravines or sometimes into [[Vacuum truck|vacuum trucks]] run by private companies who will take the waste to the treatment plant.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /> Dumping waste anywhere other than in a treatment plant is illegal.<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=https://www.oursoil.org/supporting-haitis-underground-sanitation-workers/|title=Supporting Haiti's "Underground" Sanitation Workers|work=SOIL Haiti|access-date=2017-07-30|language=en-US}}</ref> Some bayakou have been arrested for transporting waste.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.iapmonline.org/Documents/archive/20100607_Haiti_SOIL.aspx|title=Waste Not, Want Not|last=Webb|first=Steven|date=April 2010|website=IAPMonline|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-07-30}}</ref>
Before entering the pit, ''bayakou'' pour floor cleaner into the pit in order to soften the [[Fecal sludge management|fecal sludge]].<ref name=":2" /> Many ''bayakou'' clean the pit in the nude because the filth in the latrines will ruin their clothes and protective gear.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2017/07/30/540359412/haiti-s-bayakou-hauling-away-human-excrement-by-hand|title=Haiti's 'Bayakou': Hauling Away Human Excrement By Hand|last=Hersher|first=Rebecca|date=30 July 2017|website=NPR|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-07-30}}</ref> Hazards of the job include injury from objects thrown into latrines and exposure to infectious diseases such as [[cholera]].<ref name=":3" />
''Bayakou'' and their families also face [[social stigma]] for working with [[human waste]].<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":3" />
== References == <!--- See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Footnotes on how to create references using <ref></ref> tags, these references will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}
== External links == * ''[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1GugPtVyXI0 Choléra : Ignoble plongée dans les égouts de Port-au-Prince - Haïti]'' (2014 Video in French)
<!--- Categories --->

{{Multiple issues| {{Advert|date=April 2013}} {{notability|date=April 2013}} {{refimprove|date=April 2013}} }} {{infobox biodatabase |title = BitterDB |logo =[[File:Database.png]] |description =[[Bitter (taste)|bitter]] compounds. |scope = |organism = |center = The [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]] Rehovot, Israel. |laboratory = The Robert H Smith Faculty of Agriculture |author = Ayana Wiener |citation = Wiener & al. (2012)<ref name="pmid21940398"/> |released = 2011 |standard = |format = |url = http://bitterdb.agri.huji.ac.il |download = |webservice = |sql = |sparql = |webapp = [http://bitterdb.agri.huji.ac.il/bitterdb/dbbitter.php#BlastReceptors blast] |standalone = |license = |versioning = |frequency = |curation = |bookmark = |version= }} The '''BitterDB''' is a database of compounds that were reported to taste [[Bitter (taste)|bitter]] to humans.<ref name="pmid21940398">{{cite journal |last=Wiener|first=Ayana|author2=Shudler Marina |author3=Levit Anat |author4=Niv Masha Y |date=Jan 2012|title=BitterDB: a database of bitter compounds|journal = Nucleic Acids Res.|volume=40|issue=Database issue|pages=D413–9|publisher= |location = England| issn = | pmid = 21940398|doi = 10.1093/nar/gkr755| bibcode = | oclc =| id = | url = | pmc =3245057 | accessdate = | laysummary = | laysource = | laydate = }}</ref>
==Summary== Basic taste qualities like sour, salty, sweet, bitter and umami serve specific functions in identifying food components found in the diet of humans and animals, and are recognized by proteins in the oral cavity. Recognition of bitter taste and aversion to it are thought to protect the organism against the ingestion of poisonous food compounds, which are often bitter. Bitter taste receptors are expressed not only in the mouth but also in extraoral tissues. BitterDB database, available at http://bitterdb.agri.huji.ac.il/bitterdb/, includes over 670 compounds that were reported to taste bitter to humans. The compounds can be searched by name, chemical structure, similarity to other bitter compounds, association with a particular human bitter taste receptor, and so on. The database also contains information on mutations in bitter taste receptors that were shown to influence receptor activation by bitter compounds.
==Database overview==
===Bitter compounds=== [[File:Search Examples of bitter compounds in BitterDB.jpg|frame|right|alt=|Search Examples of bitter compounds in BitterDB]] '''BitterDB''' currently contains more than 670 compounds that were cited in the literature as bitter. For each compound, the database offers information regarding its molecular properties, references for the compound’s bitterness, including additional information about the bitterness category of the compound (e.g. a ‘bitter-sweet’ or ‘slightly bitter’ annotation), different compound identifiers (smiles, CAS registry number, IUPAC systematic name), an indication whether the compound is derived from a natural source or is synthetic, a link to the compound’s [[PubChem]] entry and different file formats for downloading (sdf, image, smiles). Over 200 bitter compounds have been experimentally linked to their corresponding human bitter taste receptors. For those compounds, BitterDB provides additional information, including links to the publications indicating these ligand–receptor interactions, the effective concentration for receptor activation and/or the [[EC50]] value and links to the associated bitter taste receptors entries in the '''BitterDB'''.
====Querying and browsing==== Bitter compounds can be queried and browsed in different ways. For example, 'advanced search' option allows user to retrieve compounds that fit different criteria, such as a combination of specific physical properties or a combination of associated human bitter taste receptors. In addition to the querying options the user can browse through a sort-able table with all the '''BitterDB''' compounds.
===Bitter taste receptors=== In addition, '''BitterDB''' contains data about the 25 known human bitter taste receptors. Several properties are displayed for each receptor. The bitter taste receptors can be searched using different criteria: name, known ligands and [[UniProt]] accession number. Using a table that presents all the bitter taste receptors and some information about them, the user can browse and also sort by various options, such as the number of bitter ligands associated with the receptor.
===Local BLAST service and global alignment=== '''BitterDB''' offers two additional features: a local [[BLAST]] service to determine the local similarity between a query sequence and the different human bitter taste receptors, and a global alignment of the 25 human bitter taste receptors. The alignment was generated using [[Clustalw|ClustalW2]], and displays the secondary structure of each receptor, as predicted by the TOPCONS server.
===Users can upload bitter compounds=== '''BitterDB''' offers an ‘upload’ option, by which the users are encouraged to submit information about bitter compounds. These data will be reviewed by the authors and uploaded to the database accordingly. The users can join the mailing list in order to receive database updates.
==Examples==
{{Empty section|date=February 2013}}
==See also== * [[Bitter (taste)|Bitter]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== * http://bitterdb.agri.huji.ac.il/bitterdb/

page.title: Child Health and Nutrition Research Initiative

revision.comment: link [[Millennium Development Goals]] using [[:en:User:Edward/Find link|Find link]]
revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=April 2007}} Founded in 2001, the '''Child Health Nutrition Research Initiative''' ('''CHNRI''') is a network of interested partners supported by the [[Global Forum for Health Research]], based in [[Geneva]], Switzerland. CHNRI efforts support the [[Millennium Development Goals]] of: * Eradicating extreme [[poverty]] and [[hunger]] * Reducing [[child mortality]] * Combating [[HIV/AIDS]], [[malaria]] and diseases in children
CHNRI is helping to set research priorities in [[child health]], development and nutrition, and resolve related methodological issues. It also sponsors research into priority child health and nutrition problems, especially in low- and middle-income countries, with a focus on research to inform policies for scaling up effective interventions.
CHNRI focuses on increasing the level of communication and discussion amongst players devoted to research on child health and nutrition; such as nutritionists, child health specialists, and child development specialists. It provides a platform to initiate and maintain debate on the importance and direction of the research, bringing scientists together and implementing bodies to discuss issues relevant to the current status of knowledge and the requirements for the future.
The secretariat of CHNRI is now located in [http://www.inclentrust.org The INCLEN Trust International]. The board is chaired by [http://faculty.jhsph.edu/Default.cfm?faculty_id=61 Dr Robert E. Black]{{dead link|date=November 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, Professor and Chair, Department of International Health, [[Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health]], United States.
== External links == * {{Official website|http://www.chnri.org/|CHNRI official website}}
[[Category:Organizations established in 2001]] [[Category:Organisations based in Geneva]] [[Category:International medical and health organizations]] [[Category:Children's health-related organizations]] [[Category:Child-related organisations in Switzerland]]

revision.text:
The '''Commission on Dental Competency Assessments''' (formerly the '''North East Regional Board of Dental Examiners''') is one of five examination agencies for [[dentist]]s in the [[United States]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.ada.org/en/education-careers/licensure/licensure-dental-students|title=Clinical Testing for Dentist Licensure|website=www.ada.org|language=en|access-date=2017-02-21}}</ref> The other examination agencies are the [[Western Regional Examining Board]], the [[Central Regional Dental Testing Service]], the [[Council of Interstate Testing Agencies, Inc.]] and the [[Southern Regional Testing Agency]].<ref>http://www.ada.org/en/publications/ada-news/2016-archive/march/ada-calls-for-increased-licensure-portability</ref> These were organized to better standardize clinical exams for licensure. Historically each state had its own independent licensing exam.
On January 9, 2015, the NERB became the Commission on Dental Competency Assessments (CDCA).<ref>http://www.ada.org/en/publications/ada-news/2015-archive/february/north-east-regional-board-is-now-the-commission-on-dental-competency-assessments</ref>
The CDCA (formerly NERB), administers the ADEX Dental and Dental Hygiene Exams.<ref>http://adexexams.org/faq/</ref> The CDCA also administers Dental Specialty exams<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdcaexams.org/specialty-exam/|title=Specialty Exam {{!}} CDCA|website=www.cdcaexams.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-16}}</ref>, a Florida Laws and Rules exam<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdcaexams.org/florida-laws-and-rules-dental-hygienist-2/|title=Florida Laws and Rules – Dental Hygienist {{!}} CDCA|website=www.cdcaexams.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-16}}</ref>, and an Expanded Function Dental Assistant (EFDA) exam<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdcaexams.org/dental-auxiliary-information/|title=Dental Auxiliary Exam Information {{!}} CDCA|website=www.cdcaexams.org|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-16}}</ref>.
The CDCA has grown to include 44* states, Washington, DC, Puerto Rico, US Virgin Islands and Jamaica. The only states that still do not accept the CDCA for both Dental and Hygiene exams are: Alaska, *California (''expected'' Dental ''in'' ''2018)'', Delaware, Georgia, *Nebraska ''(accepts ''Dental'' but not ''Hygiene'')'', *New York ''(accepts ''Hygiene'' but not ''Dental'')'', Oklahoma and *South Dakota (''expected'' Dental ''and'' Hygiene ''in 2018)'' .<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cdcaexams.org/adex-acceptance-map/|title=ADEX Acceptance Map {{!}} CDCA|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cdcaexams.org|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-03}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" |+ !U.S. State or Other Country !Accepts CDCA ADEX Dental Exam !Accepts CDCA ADEX Hygiene Exam |- |ALABAMA |Y |Y |- |'''ALASKA''' |'''N''' |'''N''' |- |ARIZONA |Y |Y |- |ARKANSAS |Y |Y |- |'''CALIFORNIA''' |'''N''' (expected acceptance 2018) |'''N''' |- |COLORADO |Y |Y |- |CONNECTICUT |Y |Y |- |DC |Y |Y |- |'''DELAWARE''' |'''N''' |'''N''' |- |FLORIDA |Y |Y |- |'''GEORGIA''' |'''N''' |'''N''' |- |HAWAII |Y |Y |- |IDAHO |Y |Y |- |ILLINOIS |Y |Y |- |INDIANA |Y |Y |- |IOWA |Y |Y |- |JAMAICA |Y | - |- |KANSAS |Y |Y |- |KENTUCKY |Y |Y |- |LOUISIANA |Y |Y |- |MAINE |Y |Y |- |MARYLAND |Y |Y |- |MASSACHUSETTS |Y |Y |- |MICHIGAN |Y |Y |- |MINNESOTA |Y |Y |- |MISSISSIPPI |Y |Y |- |MISSOURI |Y |Y |- |MONTANA |Y |Y |- |NORTH CAROLINA |Y |Y |- |'''NEBRASKA''' |Y |'''N''' |- |NEVADA |Y |Y |- |NEW JERSEY |Y |Y |- |NEW MEXICO |Y |Y |- |'''NEW YORK''' |'''N''' |Y |- |NEW HAMPSHIRE |Y |Y |- |NORTH DAKOTA |Y |Y |- |OHIO |Y |Y |- |'''OKLAHOMA''' |'''N''' |'''N''' |- |OREGON |Y |Y |- |PENNSYLVANIA |Y |Y |- |PUERTO RICO |Y | - |- |RHODE ISLAND |Y |Y |- |SOUTH CAROLINA |Y |Y |- |'''SOUTH DAKOTA''' |'''N''' (expected acceptance 2018) |'''N''' (expected acceptance 2018) |- |TENNESSEE |Y |Y |- |TEXAS |Y |Y |- |UTAH |Y |Y |- |VERMONT |Y |Y |- |VIRGINIA |Y |Y |- |U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS |Y | - |- |WASHINGTON |Y |Y |- |WEST VIRGINIA |Y |Y |- |WISCONSIN |Y |Y |- |WYOMING |Y |Y |}
==References== {{Reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=June 2018}} {{Orphan|date=March 2016}} {{Infobox Magazine | title = Complete Wellbeing | company = Complete Wellbeing Publishing Pvt Ltd | paid_circulation = | unpaid_circulation = | total_circulation = | based = Mumbai | frequency = Monthly | language = English | category = Personal growth magazine | editor = Manoj Khatri | editor_title = Editor | firstdate = 1 November 2006 | country = India | website = [http://www.completewellbeing.com/ ''Complete Wellbeing''] }} '''''Complete Wellbeing''''' was a [[Personal development|personal growth]] [[magazine]] founded in 2006. It was published from [[Mumbai, India]], and distributed all over the country. It stopped publishing its print edition with its June 2016 issue. It continues to publish content on its [https://completewellbeing.com website].
==History and profile== ''Complete Wellbeing'' was first published on 1 November 2006.<ref name="afa">{{cite news|title=New magazine, 'Complete Wellbeing', to be launched|url=http://www.afaqs.com/news/story/16259_New-magazine-Complete-Wellbeing-to-be-launched|accessdate=25 September 2016|work=Afaqs|date=27 October 2006}}</ref> The magazine promotes the idea that individuals are not sum of parts but an integrated whole. In other words, one's [[mind]], body and [[soul]] must work in harmony to feel well. It highlights the inter-connectedness of an individual's physical, mental, emotional and spiritual aspects. The magazine targets both men and women.<ref name="afa"/>
In 2012 ''Complete Wellbeing'' received the Medscape India Award for excellence in media for wellbeing.<ref>[http://www.mxmindia.com/2012/06/complete-wellbeing-bags-medscape-award/ MXM India Complete wellbeing bags medscape award]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://completewellbeing.com/ Official website]
[[Category:2006 establishments in India]] [[Category:English-language magazines in India]] [[Category:Health magazines]] [[Category:Indian monthly magazines]] [[Category:Indian magazines]] [[Category:Magazines about spirituality]] [[Category:Magazines established in 2006]] [[Category:Media in Mumbai]]
